programmes.show_description: (2020) Dark Adam Brody comedy. Abe was a childhood detecting prodigy but is now a failing PI. But when a local boy is killed Abe gets the case. Things are looking up (for Abe, not the boy).
(1971) Crime thriller starring Richard Crenna. A recently paroled thief must do one last job to pay off old debts. But can he get away with it and build a life with his new girlfriend?
Teleshopping.
Teleshopping.
(1970) Multi-Oscar-winning, fact-based, Second World War drama starring George C Scott, who gives a vivid portrait of the famously straight-talking US commander General George Patton.
(1959) Western. Randolph Scott plays a bounty hunter who has unfinished business with the brother of his latest target. But his quest for revenge looks like it could be undermined.
Director Steven Spielberg and stars Tom Hanks and Mark Rylance talk about making their Cold War espionage drama.
(1949) World War II drama starring Gregory Peck as a US general who must treat a demoralised bomber squadron severely to restore discipline. With Oscar-winning support from Dean Jagger.
(1993) Comedy starring Robin Williams and Sally Field. A struggling actor dresses as a woman to get his estranged wife to hire him as a housekeeper, so he can spend more time with his kids.
(2023) Sci-fi extravaganza starring John David Washington. An undercover operative must destroy a superweapon in a war against AI. But the superweapon looks like a little girl.

programmes.show_name: The Witch: Part 2 - The Other One
programmes.show_description: (2022) Park Hoon-jung's blood-soaked sci-fi horror sequel starring Shin Si-ah as a super-powered lab experiment let loose on the world to terminate with extreme prejudice and some gusto.
(2022) Lo-fi sci-fi. In 1940, two sisters invent a contraption that intercepts future broadcasts. But it inadvertently creates an alternate timeline in which the Nazis win the war. Oops.
Teleshopping.
Teleshopping.
(2020) Touching adventure with Harrison Ford, based on Jack London's classic novel. A big, friendly hound finds himself unwittingly travelling across late 19th-century North America.
(1952) Screwball comedy starring Cary Grant as a scientist who drinks the elixir of youth and starts acting the fool, as does his strait-laced wife (Ginger Rogers).
(2022) Family comedy with Michael Pe√±a. A young lad discovers that his slacker dad is a superhero. And before he's got used to the idea, he must foil a villain's plot to bring his dad down.
(2004) All-action thriller. Queen Latifah stars as the driver of the fastest taxi in New York, who teams up with an inept cop (Jimmy Fallon) to catch a team of female bank-robbers.
Director Steven Spielberg and stars Tom Hanks and Mark Rylance talk about making their Cold War espionage drama.
(1997) Action thriller starring Pierce Brosnan and Linda Hamilton. The inhabitants of a volcano-side resort unwisely ignore a scientist's warning about its imminent eruption.
(2014) Thriller. Denzel Washington stars as an ex-soldier who comes out of retirement to help a teenage sex worker who's been assaulted by her pimp.
(1996) Peter Jackson's comedy horror stars Michael J Fox as a psychic investigator in a town that has more ghouls and ghosties than you can shake a spirit stick at. But is he a fraud?
